dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The city skyline illuminates the clouded sky above. An elevated train blots out the view as it passes by at c proximity.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Four PASSENGERS. They sit some distance from one another. SEAN, 30’s, is the best looking of the bunch. Crystal blu eyes. A fashionably worn leather jacket and shoes to matc He leans his head against a window towards the front of t car. The train comes to a stop. The door opens. LISA, 20’s, enters and finds a seat acros from Sean. She has on green hospital scrubs. Her hair is unnaturally BLACK. So is her fingernail polish. She reaches into her purse and pulls out a copy of “TWILIGHT”. She opens the book and begins to read. The tr continues. She looks up to digest something she just read. She catch Sean staring at her. He smiles.

dialogues.speaker: SEAN
dialogues.text: I read all of those. Interesting take on vampires.

dialogues.speaker: LISA
dialogues.text: Me too. This one’s my fave though. Third time.

dialogues.speaker: SEAN
dialogues.text: Seems like everyone is infatuated with vampires these days. They either want to date one... or be one.

dialogues.speaker: LISA
dialogues.text: You talking about the hair? He nods. She smiles. Pulls a lock of it into her view.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got all vamped up for a costume party a couple of weeks ago. Just couldn’t seem to let the color go.

dialogues.speaker: SEAN
dialogues.text: It suits you. I’m Sean.

dialogues.speaker: LISA
dialogues.text: Lisa. She dives back into her book.

dialogues.speaker: SEAN
dialogues.text: I just have a hard time believing it would be so easy to be a vampire. She remains engrossed in her book.

dialogues.speaker: SEAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: In Bram’s version it wasn’t easy. Always hunted...

dialogues.speaker: LISA
dialogues.text: Bram? She looks up. Squints her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: SEAN
dialogues.text: Bram Stoker? He wrote Dracula? Pretty much put vampires on the map.

dialogues.speaker: LISA
dialogues.text: Oh, I had to read that in high school. I thought it sucked.

dialogues.speaker: SEAN
dialogues.text: You're a fan of vampires, yet you didn’t like Dracula? She shrugs her shoulders. Offers a guilty smile.

dialogues.speaker: LISA
dialogues.text: Nope, sorry. Thought it was boring.

dialogues.speaker: SEAN
dialogues.text: Maybe being a vampire is not supposed to be so glamorous. Always hunted, truly cursed in love, and the decisions.  Sean shakes his head. Looks at the passengers.

dialogues.speaker: LISA
dialogues.text: Decisions?

dialogues.speaker: SEAN
dialogues.text: Who to kill. To live with the guilt of playing god.

dialogues.speaker: LISA
dialogues.text: I would think they would just eat animals. Like the Cullens. She points to her book.

dialogues.speaker: SEAN
dialogues.text: Humans eat animals. Not vampires.

dialogues.speaker: LISA
dialogues.text: Says you. I think it’s okay to make changes in the legend. Times change. People’s tastes differ.

dialogues.speaker: SEAN
dialogues.text: Because that’s not a curse. Seems more like a gift. Would you still want to be a vampire if you had to kill people? She crumples her face. Taps fingers on her chin.

dialogues.speaker: LISA
dialogues.text: I think so. They’re just so beautiful. So misunderstood.

dialogues.speaker: SEAN
dialogues.text: Really? Then humor me for a second. You're a vampire who likes to hunt on late night trains... He smiles. She rolls her eyes. He nods his head towards the other passengers. SEAN (CONT’D) Which one? She peruses the train. A thin OLD MAN, 70's, with a Hombu hat on his head sits towards the back of the car. A PLUMP WOMAN, 40's, ruffles through a purse the size of gym bag. She chews gum at a fevered pace.  A LARGE MAN, 30's, rests his head against the window. He wears a sleeveless vest. Arms covered in tattoos. A banda on his head. Lisa smiles.

dialogues.speaker: LISA
dialogues.text: You don’t think I could do it, do you?

dialogues.speaker: SEAN
dialogues.text: Then do it.

dialogues.speaker: LISA
dialogues.text: The big guy, with all the tatt’s. Sean studies him with her.

dialogues.speaker: SEAN
dialogues.text: Why him?

dialogues.speaker: LISA
dialogues.text: Because he looks like a thug. Like he’s a gang member.

dialogues.speaker: SEAN
dialogues.text: Who knows, he could be a big teddy bear. Maybe he’s a hard working guy, three children at home and a loving wife.

dialogues.speaker: LISA
dialogues.text: Or, maybe he’s gang member. Back to her book.

dialogues.speaker: SEAN
dialogues.text: So you would just pick people based on their looks?

dialogues.speaker: LISA
dialogues.text: Why not? Gotta feed right? Lisa laughs.

dialogues.speaker: SEAN
dialogues.text: Sooner or later, it would get to you... I think there’s a better candidate over there. Lisa purses her lips. Sean nods to the passengers again. takes them in. She

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then the fat woman. Sean gazes at the woman.

dialogues.speaker: SEAN
dialogues.text: Why her?

dialogues.speaker: LISA
dialogues.text: I just have a problem with people who don‘t take care of themselves.

dialogues.speaker: SEAN
dialogues.text: Maybe she has a thyroid problem, or low self esteem. Lisa sighs. Throws up her hands.

dialogues.speaker: LISA
dialogues.text: Then you pick one, Dr. Phil.

dialogues.speaker: SEAN
dialogues.text: The old man. Sean stares at the old man with piercing eyes.

dialogues.speaker: LISA
dialogues.text: Why him? He looks harmless.

dialogues.speaker: SEAN
dialogues.text: His name is Edgar Wilcox. He’s a retired auto worker. He actually does have three kids and a loving wife... Sean’s eyes return to Lisa.

dialogues.speaker: SEAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: He’s also a pedophile. The train begins to slow.

dialogues.speaker: LISA
dialogues.text: How? Why do you know this?

dialogues.speaker: SEAN
dialogues.text: Because, it’s the best I can do. Sean stands. Lisa can see her reflection in the window be him, but not his. Her eyes widen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're gonna want to get off this train now. He walks towards the others. She fumbles her book trying get it into her purse. She hastens to the door. Bounces i anticipation of it’s opening.

dialogues.speaker: SEAN
dialogues.text: Edgar Wilcox? Lisa turns her back to them. Closes her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: EDGAR, (0.8.)
dialogues.text: Yes. Do I know...

dialogues.speaker: LARGE MAN, (0.8.)
dialogues.text: What the fuck? Oh my god! SCREAMS. Flesh TEARING. Heavy FOOTSTEPS in the car. Lisa covers her mouth. The doors open. EXT. TRAIN PLATFORM —- CONTINUOUS Lisa gets knocked over by the large man. The plump woman past. Lisa picks up her bag. Runs to the turn-stile.

dialogues.speaker: SEAN, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Lisa! She stops and turns. A mistake. Sean's blood spattered face is pressed up against the win He stares at her wide eyed, crazed. He licks his fangs as fingers rake crimson down the glass.

dialogues.speaker: SEAN
dialogues.text: Ain't so pretty now, are we? The train doors shut. Lisa faints. Sean SCREAMS as the train resumes. FADE TO BLACK. THE END.
